page.title: 08Papa Stours weather.
page.content: Shetland is a windy place because we are low lying.The average windspeed for each day last year was 14 knots. Even in summer a still day is rare. Being so far North, in the summer the days are very long, with hardly any night.Last year June was the sunniest month with 5.2 hours of sun shine a day,on average.Although the warmest was August with an average temperature of12.7 degrees Celsius The rainfall last year was 1090mm. with October (173mm) as the wettest. Our rainfall is generally comparable to South Western Scotland. January was the coldest month (1.7c) and as we are exposed to the north we do get quite a lot of snow.Fortunately ,it doesnt lie for very long ,because we are an island. We can be subjected to particularly severe gales around the Equinox.
